title: Wixárika Healing Ceremony | Smithsonian Institution
author: Smithsonian Institution
cleaned_text: Social Media Share Tools Object Details - Creator - Smithsonian Center for Folklife and Cultural Heritage - Description - The religious life of the Wixárika people is tied to both the agricultural calendar and to mystical practices. Here, Alejandro Severiano Carrillo Carrilo, a Jalisco craftsman and healer, and Eleuteria de la Cruz Ramirez, the Wixárika Union President, discusses some of the most important ceremonies. - Published Date - Wed, 01 Sep 2010 09:45:00 GMT - Type - Blog posts - Smithsonian staff publications - Blog posts - Smithsonian Center for Folklife and Cultural Heritage - Topic - Cultural property - Record ID - posts_1e762d3094a67f0181fbc001c7c00bcf - Metadata Usage (text) - Usage conditions apply
